website_summaries.verdict: Extremely large printer with a higher-than-average price tag, but it excels in photo printing.
pros: Ships with 8 ink cartridges, meaning it will deliver excellent photo results, both full-color photos and black-and-white photos
Can print pages as large as 13” x 9”
Wireless connectivity, so you can print items from your mobile devices easily
Large enough to offer two paper trays
cons: Consumables can be expensive with 8 cartridges

customer_reviews.title: You won't regret it!
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful printer, but it was difficult getting set up. Love the photo quality, and doesn't seem to use too much ink. Have printed at least 30 8.5x11" photos, and 10 13x19" photos, with about half of my ink levels left.
customer_reviews.author: Rudy

customer_reviews.title: Clogged Printhead
customer_reviews.text: This printer has become a money pit for me. After doing two months of solid work printing game design components for me, the printhead became clogged. Numerous attempts at cleaning and deep cleaning cycles didn't work. Taking the existing printhead out and trying to clean it myself didn't work. A brand new printhead replacement went in and the same issue is there: half the inks won't print and the new printhead was saturated with ink on the side that wasn't printing when attempting the test page. Frustrated doesn't begin to cover it.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth F Guerin

customer_reviews.title: Ink splats, clogged heads, ink eater, beware!
customer_reviews.text: We have had this printer for three months. We use it daily. First of all, it is astonishing how much ink it goes through. There is constantly ink blots on the prints, ruining the whole sheet. It gets clogged with no warning and will print miscolored. So a whole run will be ruined with no notice. It is incredibly finicky and difficult to use. It' the worst printer we've ever purchased, I was hoping it would be a great replacement for our beloved Epson 1430 but it is definitely NOT. Don't bother!
customer_reviews.author: sophie wickham

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Pro Printer for Artists
customer_reviews.text: This is a PHENOMENAL and reliable art printer. I am not at all resentful of the amount of space it takes up in my studio. I'm SO happy to be able to print my own gallery-ready work these days. It streamlines everything, and the results are just stunning. I couldn't recommend this more to artists who are tired of placing print orders for hundreds of dollars. The ink and upkeep here, in my experience, really make that a thing of the past. The work I've printed with this has sold well in galleries, and impresses everyone who gets close.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis

customer_reviews.title: Prints on thick cardstock!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a printer that would print on 100 lb cover cardstock. This works perfectly. I also use it to print photos and it does a great job. I've had it for almost 2 years. Still works great.
customer_reviews.author: SM3

customer_reviews.title: Extreme disappointment. Unfortunate that we can't print on 13x19" media as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Extremely disappointing experience. Wish I had tried things out earlier; I certainly would have returned it but missed the 30 day window. I have never been able to get it to print on 13x19" paper as that was the primary reason for the purchase. Also the printed colors are WAAAYYYY off from what is displayed on the screen. The printer prints a lot of blues even when there are no blues in the images. If there are blues in the images, they are way overblown in the print. I haven't yet made it through for tech support so hopefully I can eventually get assistance. As of now, I wouldn't pay $50 for this piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: James D. Pope

customer_reviews.title: Giant pain in the *ss.
customer_reviews.text: I am ready to throw this piece of crap in the garbage. It will not connect wirelessly to anything. It is extraordinarily large and very heavy. It is not compatible with my cricut explore which is one of the main reasons I bought it. When printing images from the cricut or actual photos, it produces muddy ugly colors. I have looked online and this is a common problem with no way to fix it. Do yourself a favor and get something else, which I now need to do.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly T

customer_reviews.title: Amazing budget printer, does not work wirelessly though
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend uses this printer to make prints of his artwork and I use it for photos. IT IS AMAZING, THE QUALITY IS CRISP AND THE COLORS ARE BEAUTIFUL. Photoshop has been a big help and calibrating the monitor is super important. One con is that the printer will NOT, under any circumstances, print anything wirelessly. The printer is connected to wifi, the computer is too, and it won't print anything for the life of me. If you hate cords, you're going to want a different printer. Overall it is a great product though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Such gorgeous printing!
customer_reviews.text: This printer is amazing. I did notice a lot of people saying it printed very bland colors but like a lot of reviews stated: there are 2 sides to the printing paper. If you use basic office printer paper, youre going to get boring icky bleeding and muted colors. I recommend you pick up actual inkjet paper. It makes a world of difference. I picked up a pack of 400 sheets for like $6. If you print of actual photo paper, it is absolutely GORGEOUS. Like...i was blown away by the amount of detail and quality.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Grace

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this model, you want the Pro-100S instead
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this monster of a printer and then realized how outdated the software is. It has WiFi-support, but only via a WPS button or the setup software on the included CD-ROM (!). The Canon mobile app doesn't seem to support it at all, and it doesn't have support for cloud printing. You almost certainly want the Pro-100S model which is the same physical printer with updated software and all of those modern things. Also note that neither model has a scanner or copy functionality.
customer_reviews.author: Don Schwarz

customer_reviews.title: Heed The Low Ratings
customer_reviews.text: I had always purchased Canon printers, but because of this printer I will change my thinking. This has got to be the most frustrating printer I've ever owned. Maybe it just wasn't designed to work well with Windows 10, but it's a headache every time I try to print. From phantom paper jams, to stopping mid print, it's a horrible printer. And when ink costs $100, you really don't want to be wasting any. You get what you deserve if you but this over-sized doorstop.
customer_reviews.author: Furiousdog

customer_reviews.title: Not a fan
customer_reviews.text: After days of struggle to try and get this printer to work, I ended up sending it back. It would not produce one usable print with my mac. I tried downloading the appropriate software, called their customer service. Nothing but frustration. The refund was prompt. Beware though, that not all UPS drop-off locations will accept the "just drop it off" option!!! You may end up with a hefty bill unless your UPS employees know how to do the work-around (you email them - to "a friend"- the return label, they print it out at their location).
customer_reviews.author: Stephen P.

customer_reviews.title: print quality is terrible. Goes offline every two seconds
customer_reviews.text: print quality is terrible. Goes offline every two seconds, doesn't work well with odd sized papers. Do not buy this product it will cost you hours of your time trying to print every single item.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: Works great except...
customer_reviews.text: This printer holds no surprises for anyone who has used the Canon brand. The one exception is the Luster paper they include with the printer. I had a quick must do print job. I was using Canon Glossy and the prints were to the high standards I expect from Canon. I ran out of paper and put in the free sheets of Luster paper they include. Changing nothing in the printer, the print quality was horrible. I spent the last four sheets of the free paper trying to get a quality print to no avail! As soon as I put in glossy paper again, the print quality returned and all was well.
customer_reviews.author: The Rifleman

customer_reviews.title: Have not been able to do one good print from this printer
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if it was a damage printer we got or something but it has not worked. All the prints come out horrible and i just cant figure out why no matter what paper i select and this printer cost so much why does paper type give different colors. At this point I do not know what the hell to do. I did print head cleaning and still having issues printing on business card paper and photo paper.
customer_reviews.author: Odean Williams

customer_reviews.title: If it will connect it works beautifully. But it rarely connects.
customer_reviews.text: When it decides it wants to receive data from the laptop, it prints beautifully. But 8 times out of 10 it seem's incapable of remaining online and able to receive data from the laptop. The wireless feature is absolutely useless, even connected via USB it gives errors stating the printer is offline, in an error mode or otherwise unable to communicate. Super expensive printer that is incapable of printing 99% of the time and prints beautifully 1% of the time. Don't waste your money on this POS. Either Cannon hates Windows 10 or Windows 10 hates Cannon. Either way I've wasted way too much money on a giant paper weight.
customer_reviews.author: Highly Opinionated

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: Very good printer, found "NextPage" alternative cartridge's on Amazon, just a little over $22 can't tell difference from Canon cartrages. I have had this Printer with these cartrages now for some years and I am very satisfied. Rob
customer_reviews.author: Rob Ryane

customer_reviews.title: This is the printer to buy if you're self-printing for Etsy or any other art shop.
customer_reviews.text: I've had an absolutely fantastic experience printing art and photos for my Etsy shop with the printer. Yes, you need to buy the OEM ink. Yes, you need to buy good paper. Look for rebates on the Canon site before purchasing and make sure you follow the rebate rules and you can get a fantastic deal! I got a good 50 prints (8.5x11 and 13x19 with the ink that was included in the box). I print high-quality pro photos and art with a great deal of color and I've been super happy with this printer. If you have a Mac, it's worth the time to call the support line and have them help you set up.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan Crutchfield

customer_reviews.title: Printer for the Photographer at heart
customer_reviews.text: Best Photo Printer for my purposes. I have used Canon Printers for most of my history, I tried the Epson printer but didn't like them so I went back to the Canon printers. It is big, larger than by i9900 printer. But the prints are fabulous and the size it prints makes it a great home office unit. I recommend this product. Note that the inks aren't cheap, I purchased an additional set to back up the ones that came with the printer, also from amazon.
customer_reviews.author: S. Gosenson

customer_reviews.title: So-far, so good. An excellent printer but pricey
customer_reviews.text: This printer is exceptionally well made and very heavy. It's a wide format printer, so it's wide. The only problem that I had with it is that I didn't close the flap, and it wouldn't print. It didn't tell me what the problem was until I figured it out - very frustrating. The printer's output is fantastic, but when I printed on an envelope it spread some ink on it. Not sure why. It's still a great investment and I would recommend it to others.
customer_reviews.author: JOSE A. DUARTE

customer_reviews.title: I bought this printer due to several factors which they ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer due to several factors which they had a positive reputation with Apple and use to make their print engines back in they day. Anyway with MacOS 10.13.4 (High Sierra), the software doesn't seem to recognize the printer. Also I have some issues with getting the K tray to recognize in the printer. I had to install Windows via Bootcamp just to get all features of this printer to work. My rebate was used to get Windows. Also the install disc gives an error that it isn't compatible le with the OS. Went to the Canon website to download the software that is suppose to work with High Sierra with no luck.
customer_reviews.author: ReconJoe

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done, for the most part (with a few hiccups here and there)
customer_reviews.text: This is a very solid, decent printer. Better than my old HP one that I was using. However, it does use a fair amount of ink and I often have problems with the paper feed slot-- it either won't grab the paper that's there, or it'll grab it and stop halfway through the grab and the problem light goes on. I have particular trouble with the 11x14" size, for some reason (all of this through the main paper feeding slot, not the manual feed-- that one only takes one page at a time, which is highly inconvenient). Overall, it's a good quality wide-format printer, which is what I was looking for, but it's not without its difficulties.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Rogers

customer_reviews.title: This is a great Canon photo printer
customer_reviews.text: This is a great Canon photo printer, definitely prints presentation quality photos and photos excellent enough for framing. Love that it will print up to 13x19, this is super sized!. For a business or photographer who wants to print there own awesome photos, this is the printer for you!
customer_reviews.author: C. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Printer for Producing Professional Looking Photographs
customer_reviews.text: This is a great printer for rendering exact colors, gray scales and textures of digitally captured and edited photographs. I've only been using the Pro 100 for a few months, working with a variety of paper sizes and surfaces. I'm very happy with performance and overall quality. And it's very quiet operation. I'm looking forward to the day when Canon will offer a professional photo "mega-tank" printer vs their current multiple "cartridge" printers. Though Canon ink cartridges produce outstanding prints, they are very expensive to replace. All said, I'm very impressed with the Pro 100 and hope it will keep performing at this level for a very long time.
customer_reviews.author: AMZ Customer

customer_reviews.title: Superior quality prints and photographs
customer_reviews.text: This printer has far exceeded my expectations. It was a little tedious to set up, as I have unusual circumstances (living in an RV) and it is larger than other printers, so takes up valuable space. It has, however, been very easy to use. Print quality is superior. It is, without a doubt, the best printer I have owned...and I have owned many.
customer_reviews.author: Shelley Wilson

customer_reviews.title: inconsistent prints - streaks in prints
customer_reviews.text: I have tried countless ways to make the prints clear, and I found out a lot of people were having this same issue, there is line streaks in the prints, this is brand new, I ran all the troubleshooting, and then was able to get a good print, then after that it went back to printing lines and having a lot of inconsistent prints. If you're printing photos or art prints, I would would strongly advice against this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Alejandro Solis

customer_reviews.title: 1970's computer peripherals weight back in style!
customer_reviews.text: World's heaviest ink jet printer. in the box it is 60 lbs.! Out of the box and on a desk in is 43 lbs. No vibration from this baby. Works well. Simple to setup, if cryptic. Why use careful words and detailed pictures when you could use vaguer simplified icons like Japanese comic strips (no manga, please, you don't want anything entangle in this 43 lb. unit). Anyway, i hope it does not die in 3 years like the HP equivalents. Maybe it is "lift once",
customer_reviews.author: RB Colorado

customer_reviews.title: Awesome printer, continues to impress.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my dad for Christmas. The printer is big and heavy, as expected but it prints awesome photos. He is still getting the hang of it but so far the quality of photos and and speed is great. It comes with adapters to print directly on CD's or DVD's with I think is a nice addition. Set up can be a little tedious to align the nozzles so expect to spend a half hour on it if you do manual calibration, which I did just to make sure it is calibrated good. More updates to come as time goes on.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: I hate this GD printer
customer_reviews.text: This printer was supposed to be for images---it now prints my black and white shipping labels. I might print out a garbage image from time to time, but this thing is TRASH. Images are blurry and dark. Every command takes FOR-E-VER to carry out. Somehow its using color ink when ALL I PRINT OUT IS BLACK AND WHITE SHIPPING LABELS. It takes up WAY too much space to just be a business correspondence printer, which is what its doing now. I HATE THIS THING.
customer_reviews.author: Jara Anton

customer_reviews.title: Issues with Printing
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this printer - I have been so frustrated trying to use it. I continually get an error that there is no paper in the tray (there is paper and it is the correct tray) and cannot get it to simply print. It is hit or miss. Sometimes it works, sometimes it does not - more often than not, it is not working. So FRUSTRATING!!!!! If you can, avoid purchasing this printer. I have never had so many issues printing my artwork as I have since purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: SummerAmazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hard to use...
customer_reviews.text: This is an impressive printer, but it has a few things that I don't care for. I purchased this for making high quality art prints, and I am happy with the actual printing, but the paper feed is very temperamental and often gives an error. The other problem is the actual printer software is really confusing. I have worked around this by using my photo editing software for printing, and now it works perfectly. I would, however recommend this printer for anyone looking for professional looking printed material.
customer_reviews.author: scrappygirl

customer_reviews.title: Excellent printer for the price
customer_reviews.text: Excellent overall printer, printing from Lightroom processed photos requires a very hard to find plug in for LR in order to avoid skin tones being a "peachy-pink" color. Canon's customer service was excellent in helping correct issue, but after a year, it should be a much simpler fix I would think. That said, the print quality, especially for boarderless pictures, is amazing for the price, printing up to 13" x 19" prints.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Bartholomew

customer_reviews.title: Great printer. Vendor?
customer_reviews.text: Great printer! As a graphic artist there is nothing that I've encountered so far that this will not print. The vendor though; Triplenet Pricing was very deceptive in their description. I was suppose to get 50 sheets of cannon 13 x 19 inch photo paper ($40-$50 value) which I never rec'd. When I questioned them I was told that that offer had expired, they did offer to take the printer back. Anyway. This is the best printer that I have ever owned. Color and Quality of prints is as good as anything I've encountered.
customer_reviews.author: Jim W.

customer_reviews.title: It prints well, but I have to baby sit ...
customer_reviews.text: It prints well, but I have to baby sit it constantly because it goes through so much ink. I print magazine proofs out on this thing and I can never get through printing 12 pages without having to change 1 or 2 ink cartridges. It's so frustrating! It's also very slow, even on standard mode.
customer_reviews.author: J. M. Dessler

customer_reviews.title: Borderless 13" x 17"
customer_reviews.text: Okay, so this printer is the most amazing printer ever! We haven't needed to refill the ink yet, but it does indeed perform amazingly well & print borderless photo quality & gorgeous photos. The suite that comes with the printer isn't too useful to us, since the one of us who really uses it is a digital media artist, so he primarily uses Photoshop & other digital media, but it is nice for the other one of us who is a noob and just likes pretty pictures. Definitely recommend springing for it as it is refillable & the ink costs way less than for a standard printer. Besides that, the colors are so precise! Artist recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Claudia and Ian Adams

customer_reviews.title: Great Prints and great service from Canon
customer_reviews.text: The first printer had a problem and did not work. I called Amazon and they put me through to a Canon techie. Printer still would not work, so Canon sent me a new printer. That printer is terrific. I use an Epson Artisan 1430 at my office, and it is a good printer, however the Canon Pixma Pro-100 is in a class of its own. I haven't set up the wireless capabilities yet. Be warned, the printer is large an heavy, however it is quiet and stable. I love it, great color and sharpness.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer.  Lots to learn.  High Quality Canon Professional Photo Software that works.
customer_reviews.text: What a great machine!!! Setup is easy for USB and Wireless (I suggest Wireless if your PC(s) move). Supplied USB cable is only 3 feet. This printer prints beautiful plain paper prints. I haven't tried glossy/mat/parchment/canvas paper yet, but after Irma passes by I will and report more. There is a lot to learn to effectively use this printer with all the software settings and paper. I plan to use only Canon OEM inks and high quality papers with the PRO-100. Cheap is NOT the way to go with this printer! (I use cheap inks with with my Pixma MG7520 using high quality 24# bright white inkjet paper and it works fine.)
customer_reviews.author: DougChoz

customer_reviews.title: SO Impressed!
customer_reviews.text: I am very impressed with this printer! After dealing with HP & Epson printers, this one has been the best yet. I print coloring books, and the photo cover pages and inside pages print beautifully. After going to UPS for so long to print books, this printer is definitely a money saver and super convenient. Not to mention, the ink cartridges last a very long time and create beautiful prints. If the printer has issues, the deep cleaning cycles take care of it in a flash. Yes, it is a massive printer, and it takes up a lot of desk space, but it is well worth the purchase. I would recommend this to any artist or hobbyist.
customer_reviews.author: Trina Mabbo

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: This printer is the best I have ever had! It is not a multi function printer, no scan or fax or copy, plus it has 8 color tanks, which so far have printed my photos with great detail and the colors match the original photo. If I want an exact copy, I scan the photo into my computer from my all in one printer and then print it on the Canon. Even enlargements come out like a professional photo. I am only an amateur so I may not be the expert to evaluate this printer, but for my purposes, I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: 80% of expensive ink ends up in self-cleaning
customer_reviews.text: This is a printer with fantastic print quality and versatility. However, we bought it for home use for the occasional photo print and document print. We do not recommend this printer for this purpose because it takes a long time each time you switch it on until it is ready, cleaning itself excessively. With this kind of use, the printer wastes most of its ink in the cleaning process - we know since almost all cartridges ran out at the same time. Thus, we would be cheaper off, getting our photo prints through a company. Unless you need large format prints or a printer for strong daily use, look for another high quality printer.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur Gunzl

customer_reviews.title: Not great. Bloated software
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this printer, but couldn't. The worst thing was the software bundle. It was full of bloatware, was very clunky, and dragged down the performance of my computer appreciably. Print quality was just so-so. Could probably be made better by virtue of using up a lot of paper and ink, but out of the box it wasn't even close to a pro-level lab. Not something that was worth the space it took up in the digital darkroom.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Programmed to malfunction with non cannon inks
customer_reviews.text: This machine malfunctioned to the point of “irreversible damage” due to using non-cannon inks. Canon technical support confirmed my only option was to buy a new printer even though this one purchased in May 2017 for $405!! (Less than 2 years old) They have deliberately programmed their machines to fail if any other inks are used. Replacement ink for this machine is over $115. Thanks to Canon for offering 10% off(!!!!) a new printer if i sent this machine back to them. I will never purchase a Canon product again. I NEED TO BE REFUNDED IN FULL FOR THIS AWFUL PRODUCT. DO NOT PURCHASE!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great photos
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time and undamaged; well protected in its own box as well as the shipping box. Slightly cumbersome to install software on Mac and though initial it could print via WIFI, within the span of 2 wks only printing available is thru USB cable; reinstalling the software did not correct this issue. A decently priced printer that is capable of producing large scale photos with vivid and brilliant colors
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Great printer, though pricey ink if you use Canon brand
customer_reviews.text: This printer has made truly stunning prints for me. I have good digital and film cameras, and along with Lightroom and Photoshop the combination has produced excellent results. The color matching is great. The only downside is that the ink is EXPENSIVE, but worth the cost for best results.
customer_reviews.author: Catman

customer_reviews.title: Buy an Epson
customer_reviews.text: Researched for months to find the perfect printer for my art prints. I decided to go with this printer because they were offering an awesome rebate. Needless to say, the quality is horrible. I got clearer prints from an $80 printer. Not happy at all. It’s also HUGE! I don’t understand why it has to be so big. There’s nothing to it. Was very very difficult to install and customer service is non existent. Not happy at allllllll
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: Wow, just Wow. Great quality, print speed, resulting picture. Even printed from my phone and got amazing results. Well done Cannon!
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: Would work excellent and then not
customer_reviews.text: I really thought these printers made some nice images but the first one I had and the replacement both developed similar issues with print quality after a couple weeks. I was really confused. I was getting flawless results and then I'd get defects one day. I tried troubleshooting, reinstalling, cleaning, etc. but I could not figure out what was wrong. Maybe a bad batch? Unfortunately, I need to try some more printers but I was hoping this would be the one.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: I love this printer
customer_reviews.text: I really love the prints from this printer. I bought bulk inks, re-settable cartridges and a chip resetter. I like Canon over Epson because you can use bulk inks on Canon. Great print quality. All printers are highly sensitive though. Be careful when re filling inks.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher G. Trott

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY THIS  PRINTER. Many issues with color accuracy.
customer_reviews.text: This printer got good reviews, so we tried it. We haven't been able to get accurate, streak-free prints since day 1. We've done research and tried all the tricks to get it to print with bright/clear colors in the right hue and saturation. The colors are way too dark, muddy, or when we did a test print from an independent source, it was too washed out. We've tried from several different computers w/ all same appearance on screen, only to have the colors wrong. Testing took over 30 days, so we are stuck w/ it. Going back to my $50 Canon printer that had good color until I can find an Epson to try.
customer_reviews.author: Robin S

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Printer
customer_reviews.text: Awesome prints. Just as good as if I paid Costco to print them.They only drawback is a problem that I always have with Canon products - there software is junk! None of it works worth a darn on my Windows 10 computer. This creates an issue when wanting to print to printable discs, which is you will have to make your own template in your favorite image editor (Photoshop?) to get the image to print correctly on the disc.
customer_reviews.author: Media Mogul

customer_reviews.title: Photo quality
customer_reviews.text: My old Canon I9900 finally died after a decade+. Print quality with the Pro 100 is superior to the 9900 and delivers professional results every time. I have not used any of the other features that came with this printer so won't comment. I will say, this machine is solidly built. Fit and finish excellent. If like me you just want high quality large and small format prints from your photos the Pro 100 will fit the bill.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Crager

customer_reviews.title: now that's pretty awesome! the quality of this printer
customer_reviews.text: Currently loving this printer...a lot bigger than i was expecting. I haven't unlocked the full potential of this printer yet, but being able to print from my mobile phone, now that's pretty awesome! the quality of this printer, and the detail and precision that went into manufacturing it has blown me away! Just pure quality from the get go! Highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Adam Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Good printer bad setup with no online CD software
customer_reviews.text: Great printer but setup is a pain. They gave a CD but Mac’s don’t have one. I realize it’s not Canon’s problem but any sensible electronic product company these days will have their latest software and drivers available online. All I could get online is their driver but not the software that’s on CD. People’s have done this search on google so many times that google is happily autocompleting my search for the canon CD software. You can’t even setup WiFi if your router does not support push button WEP. I am however happy with the quality, speed and quietness of this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Metamorph2

customer_reviews.title: good when they work
customer_reviews.text: I have one of these and I can tell you when they print they are great but they have huge feeder issues. sometimes the feeder works but most of the time it is a fight and a fight you wont win. I would not recommend this printer
customer_reviews.author: K. Hulse

customer_reviews.title: Print head is garbage and overpriced.
customer_reviews.text: This printer never really printed "good". It always had bands in the cyan and black inks, ive spent hundreds on ink, of which most went into "deep cleaning". Leave this printer to sit for any length of time more than a few days and everything needs a cleaning once again to achieve even basic prints. We just use a service to print our photos now, this was several hundred dollars down the drain without the purchase of another print head, which is more expensive than buying a whole new printer. Nice work Canon! RIP OFF!
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Burk

customer_reviews.title: doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item but have not been able to get it to work. There seems to be an issue with the roller feed mechanism. After doing a search, it seems to be an issue on this particular printer. I have contacted Adorama to see what I can do to rectify the issue.
customer_reviews.author: jnajla

customer_reviews.title: Great printer for the professional and hobbyist
customer_reviews.text: I am a professional photographer. My printer died and I needed to replace it quickly. After looking to replace my old printer with new (approximately $1000), I did some research on this printer. All the reviews spoke highly of the quality of prints on this one. I took a chance. I am very happy with the color and tone of the photos printed from this printer. The ink is a bit expensive, but it's worth it. With technology changing rapidly, it makes sense to save the money from the printer in order to buy other camera equipment with the savings.
customer_reviews.author: AZN8TV

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: This printer was on sale when I was looking for a new printer from which to print photos. I did my research and found this one to have some great reviews. I was anxious to try it out and found the reviews to be right on target. I absolutely LOVE the quality of the prints from this device! I feel my money was well invested.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: I can't tell you how much I love this printer. I run a small home based art business and this puppy keeps chugging along perfectly. Prints everything perfectly on luster, glossy, semi-gloss, and matte premium photo papers. And it also prints on canvas, such as Epson's Exhibition Canvas. I do recommend that you buy a color calibrator to calibrate both your monitor and printer (for each type of medium you'll be printing on) to ensure color constancy. Your best results will come from using higher quality photo papers. And I also recommend using a ink supplier, such as Precision Colors.
customer_reviews.author: Wolf Rayet

customer_reviews.title: Wont print
customer_reviews.text: I'm a very technical person and after hours and hours of trying to get this set up over the course of a month both hard wire connected and wirelessly I have yet to get it to print. I could not be more frustrated.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic printer
customer_reviews.text: I have now purchased two of these printers. They are workhorses. I have a photography show coming up where I needed 50 framed pictures for the gallery. I used this printer for all the prints and had to redo a number of them as I made editing changes to the photos. I then used it for another approximately 100 photos for an "Artist in the Park" event where I just matted the prints. Everyone who has seen any of these is impressed. Prints edge-to-edge up to 13x19 inches. I use the Lustre paper for my prints.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Howard

customer_reviews.title: what a waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Wow, what a waste of money. From the very beginning, this printer has been besieged with problem after problem. Print color, error massages, and more. I've even replaced the printhead and all inks per Canon for the latest error code to no avail--$200 more down the drain. I'm ready to chuck it, waste almost $400, and move over to an Epson. I don't think I have a "lemon" because there's an entire online community devoted to hate of tis particular printer. DO NOT buy this printer!
customer_reviews.author: Wavyart

customer_reviews.title: Great print quality, shockingly bad setup experience
customer_reviews.text: The print quality is great and assuming you have it hard wired, it is relatively easy to use. However, they shouldn't advertise this as being wifi compatible. If you don't have WPS (as is the case for all modern wifi solutions these days -- like Eero, etc), then it is simply impossible to setup on wifi. I have been trying for about 12 hours. Have watched hours of videos etc. It just doesn't work. The setup instructions and the installation guide (which I had to download, as who has a CD-ROM anymore??) are so unintuitive it hurts. Really really poor customer onboarding experience Canon. You should do better.
customer_reviews.author: sean41

customer_reviews.title: ... and heavy machine and it was delivered with the greatest care. Not even a mark on the box
customer_reviews.text: It is a large and heavy machine and it was delivered with the greatest care. Not even a mark on the box. It is also quite complex. Super instructions. We got a little help and quickly had usb access. My wife, a Graphics Designer, is setting it up to do her work. It will take some time to make it functional for our family. We are very impressed with the range of controls and options. Would prefer a Wifi Direct Hub for connectivity, but maybe someday. It is also noiseless. And a replaceable print head, unlike the dead product it replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Maria F. Waddoups

customer_reviews.title: As Advertised!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this printer to replace my prior Canon Pixma 9000. As yet, I have had no need for tech support or deep cleaning. With my experiences thusfar, and based on my prior Canon printer, I fully expect that all features, including deep cleaning, will work as intended. I have been using Canon printers for years and think they are the best in the industry.
customer_reviews.author: Nanno

customer_reviews.title: Finally a printer that prints straight and doesn’t jam or not work when needed
customer_reviews.text: The curse of bad printer luck has been lifted from me. I can now print last minute and not have to worry about a printer making me late by breaking down. Most other printers can sense fear and sabotage humans on purpose. I use this for printing everything from labels, to photos, to regular documents. It’s been nothing but great to me so far.
customer_reviews.author: Internet Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Artists
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for art prints! This is the best printing of any of my art I have ever had done - the professional printing business in my area can't even touch the color quality that this printer has. I wish I had purchased it years ago!!
customer_reviews.author: opium_writer

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer, but Slow and Heavy
customer_reviews.text: This printer prints great quality prints, but it is really slow and I could barely get it in my house when it came! I'd still recommend it for the picture quality. I use it in my art business.
customer_reviews.author: Faith Ohlinger

customer_reviews.title: Best printer I've ever owned !
customer_reviews.text: I have been using color inkjet printers for over 20 years, various brands, they all seemed to work OK. About a year ago. I bought this Canon Pixma Pro-100. I am blown away by its performance. Every photograph I print turns out beautifully. Black &White photos are superb. I am planning to purchase another Pro-100 to keep as a back-up. I would hate to be without this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne A. Strasse

customer_reviews.title: Great for making art prints!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife to start making art prints to sell of her art and this thing produces such a beautiful quality print! truely amazing for an artist to get a great product without busting the bank! you can print on all kinds of mediums with this well. It is huge though! you'll need a full computer desk just for this thing! and it weighs a ton!
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Quilty

customer_reviews.title: Artist Review- Awesome print quality
customer_reviews.text: When you have the right paper and the right settings, this print quality is INCREDIBLE! I am using the Print Studio Pro plugin for Photoshop to print. Paper quality and printer settings are very important to get right- make sure you have the right paper for the prints you want, and are using the correct settings. I love this thing. I am a freelance artist who absolutely loves being able to send prints to clients and customers, so this was an amazing purchase to help me do that with more freedom. For highest quality prints, look at more that Canon offers- there's an upgrade to this one. I am happy with this quality for now.
customer_reviews.author: Nadia Carrim

customer_reviews.title: second time around
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Canon Pro 100 Printer .It appears to be working fine.I hope that it performs good longer than the first one . It only lasted about four years before it started giving me problems. Does the type of cartridge (or brand) have a lot to do with the print quality? Israel Small
customer_reviews.author: Israel Small

customer_reviews.title: Reduces the print image to a quarter of a standard page.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to print quality graphics, but I can only get it to print in the upper left hand quarter of the page. No matter what selections for printing that I make. This is for Apples latest Mojave.
customer_reviews.author: Trish Paul

customer_reviews.title: This printer nothing but trouble!
customer_reviews.text: My Cannon PIXMA Pro9000 Mark II broke down, so I thought this could be a good successor, making the transition easy. But colors are way off. What is supposed to be orange prints magenta all the time. Colors are very light and inaccurate overall (cannot handle details). I wasted 2 hours to figure out how to make this printer accept 13 inch wide "plain" paper. It took a million tests to figure out what setting works the best. Just endless pain!
customer_reviews.author: soo

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic print quality, difficult setup for first-timers
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this printer to print out largescale printouts of visual designs for review purposes. The quality is fantastic and I'm very happy at this printer for delivering what I needed. The setup process was a bit technical and I assume that for non-technical people it might be a bit difficult. Likewise, finding and setting the ideal print settings in the different programs I use was also not very intuitive. But, once I had figured everything out, printing is a breeze and the results are excellent.
customer_reviews.author: M. Tormala

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the headache or the price
customer_reviews.text: When i first bought this printer it was great- or so i thought. Ink is $15 per cartridge atleast, and at 9 cartridges for a full set it stacks up high and they do NOT last long. Just moved to a new state and when i connected it to my computer i was riddled with error codes, and after a conversation with tech support,​ they found it was all hardware issues and needed to be brought to a facility to be fixed but evaluation would cost $75 bucks alone- not including parts and labor to actually fix the problem. They said buying a new one would be cheaper. Not wasting my time or any more money on this machine again.
customer_reviews.author: Jarred W

customer_reviews.title: An ink racket
customer_reviews.text: It prints well, but unless you want to replace ink every three uses then please avoid. This is no exaggeration. If you do even a modest amount of printing you will replace at least one cartridge every couple times you use it. The money you will save sending your work out to a professional printer is astounding. I regret buying this and so will you. It’s just not worth the space it takes up and tremendous ink expense. It is a little buggy too.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Cote

customer_reviews.title: it has been a good printer. A bit slow on the color printing
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this printer to replace my Epson Stylus Photo 2200, as it was getting impossible to purchase inks for it. So far, it has been a good printer. A bit slow on the color printing, but overall good. Noise level is minimal. Be warned, this is a very large printer similar in size to the Epson Stylus 2200 but it is well worth it as it will do 13X13.
customer_reviews.author: Florida Turtle

customer_reviews.title: Way better than my Epson large format printer.
customer_reviews.text: This is great, but the wireless I couldn't get to work with my imac. Tried several times, but still no connection. No biggy just ran a cord and extention across my room. Brilliant colors, amazing resolution in B&W.. Not looking forward to replacing the ink, but I've sold prints from this, which have paid for the ink several times over, so there's that.
customer_reviews.author: mrnobody

customer_reviews.title: Stunning photos
customer_reviews.text: This is a must have for professional use!!! Big machine heavy and it delivers!!! People believe me i have had hp printers epson other canon printers .... this one is the best !!! Super fast start set up !!! Stunning photos ! I am going to have. A lot of 5 star reviews in my handmade shop!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Nad yo

customer_reviews.title: Top notch photo printer
customer_reviews.text: This printer prints astoundingly good photographs. Their clarity and color production is superb and spot on, and never disappointed a customer. I would also add that owning one, if you sell a lot of prints, is extremely economical and cost efficient.
customer_reviews.author: Seraphim D.

customer_reviews.title: Great prints and easy set-up
customer_reviews.text: The packaging is well done and easy to unpack. The set-up was caveman simple following the provided quick set-up instructions. Prints well and the network setup was simple. Has eight ink cartridges so I ordered the multipack replacements to get a better price. I'm very happy with the printer.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Reid

customer_reviews.title: Printed images are darker than what is seen on screen. Minor tweaks to fix.
customer_reviews.text: I am using this printer for landscapes, wildflowers, wildlife and woodworking products. It is very quiet, fairly quick. On Luster paper, excellent print quality. You may need to calibrate your screen so you can print what you see on the monitor. Several app's can help brighten the image too, without much hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Robert W. Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Does not work as advertised
customer_reviews.text: All photos come out w/ a yellowish hue. I updated the driver and tried some basic troubleshooting. It prints documents fine, but its advertised as a photo printer and simply does not work. Stay away from this product.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: My work is black and white so I needed something that was going to print fine details and solid blacks
customer_reviews.text: I use these for making art prints. My work is black and white so I needed something that was going to print fine details and solid blacks. No problems whatsoever with this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Sunny Weeks

customer_reviews.title: An outstanding printer at an excellent price
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this printer specifically to print 8.5 x 11 photos from a recent African safari. The results are spectacular - rich, true colors and sharper detail than my older HP all-in-one. The ability to print even larger format images will be used on the near future. I never thought I would buy a photo only printer - but I am very happy I did. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Michael 2131

customer_reviews.title: Perfect first printer for artists
customer_reviews.text: I use this printer for my business as a pet portrait artist, and I highly recommend it for any artist who's looking to upgrade to archival prints. The hunt for a good printer can be so overwhelming, I know, but I'm so glad I chose the PIXMA PRO-100. The price is reasonable and the prints are just stunning. I love that all my illustrations can print full bleed, and the colors print very true the original artwork. Furthermore, the inks last so unbelievably long - I was worried that I'd be purchasing expensive ink packs constantly, but I've already printed over several hundred 8x10 illustrations and only had to replace 2 colors. Buy this printer!
customer_reviews.author: Beth Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Great prints
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I have only printed about 20 pictures and so far I am pleased. The setup was a little tricky because my new laptop doesn't have a CD drive, but I was able to download the drives from the canon website. I like that I am able to print multiple pictures without delay. The images come out wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: amber

customer_reviews.title: Breathtaking Quality
customer_reviews.text: Combined with Canon's Luster paper, this printer makes breathtaking prints. I actually made better prints with this than my college's professional photo lab and the very expensive Epson they've got in there. If you're just looking to print family photos, you may not find the price worthwhile, but if you're making prints to sell to clients or consumers, this is a fantastic investment to make and it'll make all the difference in the world.
customer_reviews.author: Dizzy!Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Great photo printer
customer_reviews.text: I’ve only printed a few 4x6 prints, but so far so good. The colors are true to what I’m seeing on the computer screen. I didn’t pay attention to the size when researching this printer. I was more concerned with true colors, ease in using, reviews, specs, etc., so I was quite surprised to find it measured 28” width, which meant it needed a bigger space than I had planned for it. Nevertheless, it’s set up and working great.
customer_reviews.author: J. Claxton

customer_reviews.title: Great printer
customer_reviews.text: Really a lot of fun! Ink seems to last plenty long. The prints look amazing. I was hesitant to spend $1,200 on the pro 1000 since I've only ever used cheap low cpa ink printers. I'd buy it again. I've used it to print out rehab exercises and a few other other things and it does an amazing job on stuff. If you wanna do presentations with pro grade hand outs. This will do it.
customer_reviews.author: ScottDiller

customer_reviews.title: Great quality but not reliable
customer_reviews.text: The print quality is great, but the printer itself is terrible. The internal parts move around for 15 minutes before it decided to print. Most of the time it doesn't print anyway and needs to be restarted multiple times. The software gives printing errors.
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: Really Awful
customer_reviews.text: Never works, wireless doesn't work and almost never not a problem.
customer_reviews.author: J S

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer!
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy using specialty papers with a heavier gsm weight through the manual feed!
customer_reviews.author: W. G. Mccollom

customer_reviews.title: Black Ink gets stuck at corners of papers
customer_reviews.text: It's an ok printer. I've had it now few months, didn't use it much at all, still same inks in. But when I print on Hahnemuhle papers the black ink gets stuck on corners of almost every sheet of paper. Sometimes it goes on top so it's a total waste of an expensive paper. Wouldn't invest again.
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Terrible printer
customer_reviews.text: Printer stopped working after 3 uses. Tried contacting canon support multiple times and after spending hours on hold gave up. Expensive mistake of a purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Todd

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money for a HUGE piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: Just bought this a few weeks ago and I already got a defective printer head. Seriously?! This happened to my older Pixma 9000 too. I should have listened to the warnings here. DON'T BUY! Will update after resolving with customer service.
customer_reviews.author: P. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Oops! Update
customer_reviews.text: I didn't know what I was doing. I thought I read that I could print on either side but oops, no you cant and it prints out nicely on the correct side.
customer_reviews.author: D. Williams

customer_reviews.title: A Great High-End Photo Printer
customer_reviews.text: If you need sharp, brilliant photos printed, this is the best call for the money. The only minuses are that it has no Wi-Fi, and is rather large and heavy, but those are minor problems compared to the quality of the prints.
customer_reviews.author: J. P. Boylan

customer_reviews.title: large heavy and works great.
customer_reviews.text: Other than the price of Canon Ink, this unit is fantastic. The picture quality is stunning. The Canon ink should be the only ink used in my opinion. It lasts forever on the print and doesn't seem to get used much for picture printing either. This is a big unit that can do B+ size prints. It takes a large footprint on the counter.
customer_reviews.author: J. Busse

product_meta.title: Canon Pixma Pro-100 Wireless Color Professional Inkjet Printer with Airprint and Mobile Device Printing
product_meta.description:
Style:PrinterProfessional Wireless Photo Printer with 8 dye based color inks for colorful and vivid prints

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


 It’s time to step up to the large format, professional quality printer you’ve been dreaming about. The PIXMA PRO-100 Wireless1 Professional Inkjet Printer possesses the functionality and technology you need to achieve high-quality output so your prints can look as good as the images you capture. The 8-ink dye based ChromaLife100+ system provides you with an amazing color gamut so your prints will look as vivid as you remember. 

 The PIXMA PRO-100 shares technology with the rest of the PIXMA PRO line utilizing the Optimum Image Generating System to ensure what you envision is exactly what you get. The OIG System analyzes each area of the print and chooses the best ink mixture so you see the colors you expect to see in your print. 

 The new Print Studio Pro2 plug-in software makes it even easier to get amazing results from your favorite photo applications. Add to that connectivity options like Wi-Fi, Ethernet and USB and you have a professional machine that easily fits into your workflow that you can place anywhere around the studio. 

 For media support, the PIXMA PRO-100 features two paper trays. A rear tray for a variety of fine art and glossy photo papers, and a manual slot for thicker media to meet your printing needs. 

OVERVIEW

For the 9th year in a row, Canon U.S.A. is proud to have received the 2012 Readers' Choice Award for Service & Reliability from PCMag.com for Printers 
Click here for a larger image PIXMA PRO-100 Wireless Professional Inkjet Printer 

Professional Wireless1 Photo Printer with 8 dye based color inks for vibrant and detailed prints 

 * 8 Dye based inks for amazing gradients and color, 3 of which are dedicated grayscale inks for beautiful black & white prints.
 * The Optimum Image Generating System reproduces colors as you intend them by logically selecting the optimum ink combination and placement.
 * Print Studio Pro Plug-in software2 offers a seamless and stress free photo printing workflow for professionals.
 * 4800 x 2400 dpi3 with FINE technology for incredible detail.


FEATURES & BENEFITS


 Print your Vision up to 13" x 19": 
Print professional quality photos on various media up to 13" x 19". 

 Professional Quality, Built-in: 
Canon Full-photolithography Inkjet Nozzle Engineering (FINE) features a patented print head that enables printing with microscopic droplets and high resolution up to 4800 x 2400 dpi.3 

 True Monochrome Prints: 
The 3 monochrome inks which are part of the 8-ink ChromaLife100+ system5 consist of Black, Gray, and Light Gray. These inks deliver enhanced, deep black density to raise your level of professional print quality when creating the dramatic expression of grayscale photography. 

 Uniform Ink Height: 
The Chroma Optimizer brings uniform ink height over the printed image and regulates surface reflection. This maintains the natural color and integrity of your printed photos. 

 Optimum Analysis and Mixture of Color: 
The Optimum Image Generating (OIG) System utilizes two major technologies that were first introduced in the PIXMA PRO-1. The first is a sophisticated mixing balance of inks determined from numerous ink combinations and advanced analysis. During this analysis, the OIG System carefully calculates the best results for each print mode and paper type used while looking at various image factors including color reproduction, tonal gradations, black density, and low graininess. These critical ink balancing principles are derived from Canon's expertise in imaging technology, as well as the familiar colors of life that people see and remember on a daily basis. The second is the balancing of color reproduction, tonal gradations, and uniform glossiness. The genius and power of the OIG System is truly showcased when your image is printed, exhibited, and is seen exactly as you envisioned it. 

 Pro Printing: 
The powerful Print Studio Pro plug-in software2 provides professional photographers effective printing solutions and can directly hand-over image data. Print Studio Pro is compatible with Digital Photo Professional (ver 2.1 or later), Adobe Photoshop CS, Adobe Photoshop Elements, and Adobe Photoshop Lightroom. 

 Versatile Paper Handling: 
Two-way paper feeding provides a rear tray for most supported media types and a dedicated manual feed in the back of the printer for easy loading of thicker papers. 

 Built-in CD and DVD Printing: 
Conveniently print onto your printable CD, DVD or Blu-ray Discs and jackets. 

 Built-in Wi-Fi: 
The built-in Wi-Fi1 gives you the freedom to place the printer where it’s convenient and allows multiple users to seamlessly print from several computers. 

 AirPrint: 
Enables you to print photos, email, Web pages and documents from your Apple device directly to your printer - without installing a driver.4 

 Computer-free Printing: 
A PictBridge connection lets you print photos directly from your compatible digital camera, DV camcorder, or camera phone. 

 Computer-free Printing: 
A PictBridge connection lets you print photos directly from your compatible digital camera, DV camcorder, or camera phone. 

 Hi-Speed USB: 
Plug the cable into your PC for a super-fast connection for your data transfers. 


 

COMPATIBILITY

 * Windows 7, Windows 7 SP1, Windows Vista SP1, Vista SP2, Windows XP SP3 32-bit6
 * Mac OS X v10.5.8, 10.6, 10.76



 

WHAT'S IN THE BOX

 * PIXMA PRO-100 Wireless Professional Inkjet Printer
 * CD/DVD Disc Printing Tray
 * Manuals and other documents
 * Setup CD-ROM
 * Setup Ink Tanks
 * Power Cord
 * Print Head
 * USB Cable



COMPARE

PIXMA PRO-100
Wireless Professional Inkjet Printer PIXMA PRO-10 Wireless Professional Inkjet Printer PIXMA PRO-1 Professional Inkjet Printer CURRENTLY VIEWING
Speed & Quality Ink Tanks Ink System Photo Print Speed (approx.)7 OIG System Print Resolution (up to)3 Ease of Use Professional Printing Plug-ins2 Easy-PhotoPrint Pro CD/DVD Printing Borderless Printing8 Connectivity Built-In Networking1 AirPrint4 - Direct Photo Printing9 USB Connectivity 
GENUINE CANON INKS & PAPERS

PGI-42 Black Ink Tank PGI-42 Gray Ink Tank PGI-42 Light Gray Ink Tank PGI-42 Cyan Ink Tank PGI-42 Photo Cyan Ink Tank PGI-42 Magenta Ink Tank PGI-42 Photo Magenta Ink Tank PGI-42 Yellow Ink Tank Click Here for Genuine Canon Papers 


ADDITIONAL INFORMATION

DISCLAIMERS
 1.  Wireless printing requires a working Ethernet network with wireless 802.11b/g or n capability. Wireless performance may vary based on terrain and distance between the printer and wireless network clients. Print Studio Pro plug-in software is compatible with Adobe Photoshop CS4/CS5/CS5.1, Adobe Photoshop Elements 8/9/10, Adobe Photoshop Lightroom 2.7/3 and Canon Digital Photo Professional 3.12 or later. Resolution may vary based on printer driver setting. Color ink droplets can be placed with a horizontal pitch of 1/4800 inch at minimum. Printer firmware update may be necessary for AirPrint function. Certain exceptions may apply. A PC running Windows XP or later or A Mac running OS 10.5.8 or later and USB cable required to perform firmware update. AirPrint functionality requires an iPad, iPhone 3GS or later, or iPod touch 3rd generation or later device running iOS 4.2 or later, and an AirPrint-enabled printer connected to the same network as your iOS device. A printer connected to the USB port of your Mac, PC, AirPort Base station, or Time Capsule is not supported. Based on accelerated testing by Canon in dark storage under controlled temperature, humidity and gas conditions, simulating storage in an album with plastic sleeves. Canon cannot guarantee the longevity of prints; results may vary depending on printed image, drying time, display/storage conditions, and environmental factors. See www.usa.canon.com/chromalife100plus for additional details. System requirements vary by application. For Mac OS, an Internet connection is required during software installation. For Windows OS, .NET Framework 4 is required to install My Image Garden and Quick Menu. Photo print speeds are based on the standard mode driver setting using photo test pattern(s) and select Canon Photo Paper. Print speed is measured as soon as first page begins to feed into printer and will vary depending on system configuration, interface, software, document complexity, print mode, types of paper used and page coverage. See www.usa.canon.com/printspeed for additional information. Envelopes, High Resolution Paper and certain fine art papers are NOT supported for borderless printing. Requires Canon Easy-PhotoPrint for iPhone app, available for free on the App Store, or Canon Easy-PhotoPrint for Android app available for free on Google Play. Compatible with iPhone 3G, 3GS, 4, 4S, iPod touch and Android devices running Android OS 1.6 or later. 
    
    Additional Disclaimers 
    
    CREATIVE PARK PREMIUM is a premium content service available exclusively to users only when all of the colors of genuine Canon inks are installed. Warranty programs are subject to certain conditions and restrictions. See www.usa.canon.com/support for details.

Compatible with Individual CLI 42 Ink Tanks (Black, Gray, Light Gray, Cyan, Photo Cyan, Magenta, Photo Magenta, Yellow). Save Even More On Value Packs. Only Replace The Inks That Run Out
4800 x 2400 dots per inch with FINE technology for incredible detail.Print your Vision up to 13 inches x 19 inches: Print professional quality photos on various media up to 13 inches x 19 inches

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars1,383 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
